parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>RV</title><part><name>type</name>=<value>command

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> arma3

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.14

</value></part><part><name>gr1 </name>=<value> Mods and Addons

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Returns a list of all activated addons.

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> '''activatedAddons'''

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Array]]

</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>_addons = '''activatedAddons''';</code>

</value></part><part><name>seealso</name>=<value> [[activateAddons]]
</value></part></template>

<dl class='command_description'>
<comment><!-- Note Section BEGIN -->
</comment><dd class="notedate">Posted on March 28, 2014 - 20:21</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:Tankbuster|Tankbuster]]<dd class="note">
This command can return a large array, often too large to be diag_log'd or hinted. At the time of writing, my game returned an array with 389 elements. The code below will ignore all the BI addons (they start with a3_) and writes the rest (ie, all your custom addons) to the RPT.
<code>{[[if]] (! (["a3_", _x] [[call]] [[BIS_fnc_inString]])) [[then]] {[[diag_log]] _x;}  } [[forEach]] [[activatedAddons]];</code>

<comment><!-- Note Section END -->
</comment></dl></root>
